In addition to biological screening, ultrasound monitoring helps to detect trisomy 21. If there is an abnormality on ultrasound, a foetal karyotype will be prescribed. The main signs are as follows:

In the 1st trimester: neck greater than 3.5 mm;

In the 2nd trimester: heart disease, hypoplasia or aplasia of the nasal bones, short femurs, indirect signs of duodenal stenosis... ;

In the 3rd trimester: intrauterine growth retardation with no placental cause, heart disease.

question.title: How is trisomy 21 diagnosed antenatally?
question.description: What are the main signs detected through ultrasound monitoring?

option_a.title: Biological screening and amniocentesis
option_a.description: A combination of biological screening and a prenatal test that involves removing a sample of amniotic fluid

option_b.title: Ultrasound monitoring and chorionic villus sampling
option_b.description: Regular ultrasound checks and a prenatal test that involves removing a sample of placental tissue

option_c.title: Biological screening and ultrasound monitoring
option_c.description: A combination of biological screening and regular ultrasound checks

option_d.title: Ultrasound monitoring and amniocentesis
option_d.description: Regular ultrasound checks and a prenatal test that involves removing a sample of amniotic fluid
